required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Inorganic Nitrite on Cardiovascular Hemodynamics in Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Inorganic Nitrite on Cardiovascular Hemodynamics in Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction

brief_summary.textblock: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) is a major public health problem that has no proven effective treatment. This study assessed the effects of acute nitrite administration on resting and exercise hemodynamics in patients with HFpEF.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects were studied on their long-term medications in the post-absorptive state and supine position. Right heart catheterization was performed with simultaneous expired gas analysis at rest and during supine exercise at a 20 Watts workload for 5 minutes. After the first exercise phase (before any drug administration) and after return to steady-state baseline hemodynamic values, subjects were randomized. Study drug or placebo was infused for 5 minutes. After a 10 minute observation period, hemodynamic measurements were repeated at rest, followed by repeat supine exercise at a 20 Watts workload for 5 minutes, identical to the study's first phase. Arterial and venous blood samples and hemodynamic and expired gas data were acquired during each stage of the protocol.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during repeat exercise run, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
primary_outcome.description: Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP) provides an indirect estimate of left atrial pressure (LAP). PCWP is the pressure measured by wedging a pulmonary catheter with an inflated balloon into a small pulmonary arterial branch.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Central Pressures After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) is the resistance to flow that must be overcome to push blood through the pulmonary vasculature. Acute and chronic lung disease can both cause an increase in PVR. Chronic PVR can lead to right sided heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulmonary Artery (PA) Compliance After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Pulmonary artery compliance is an index of the elasticity of the blood vessel, an indication of arterial stiffness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systemic Vascular Resistance (SVR) After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Systemic vascular resistance (SVR) refers to the resistance to blood flow offered by all of the systemic vasculature, excluding the pulmonary vasculature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Stroke Work (LVSW) After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke work refers to the work done by the ventricle to eject a volume of blood (i.e., stroke volume) into the aorta. Ventricular stroke work can be estimated as the product of stroke volume and mean aortic pressure during ejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Oxygen Consumption (VO_2) After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Arteriovenous Oxygen Content Difference After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Arteriovenous oxygen difference is the difference in the oxygen content of the blood between the arterial blood and the venous blood. It is an indication of how much oxygen is removed from the blood in capillaries as the blood circulates in the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cardiac Output After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) The volume of blood pumped per minute by each ventricle of the heart. Cardiac output is equal to the stroke volume (the amount of blood pumped from a ventricle in a single heartbeat) times the heart rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Stroke Volume After Study Drug (Resting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are resting values after receiving study drug minus resting values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke volume is the amount of blood pumped out of the heart (left ventricle - to the body) during each contraction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Central Pressures After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PVR After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) is the resistance to flow that must be overcome to push blood through the pulmonary vasculature. Acute and chronic lung disease can both cause an increase in PVR. Chronic PVR can lead to right sided heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PA Compliance After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Pulmonary artery compliance is an index of the elasticity of the blood vessel, an indication of arterial stiffness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in SVR After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Systemic vascular resistance (SVR) refers to the resistance to blood flow offered by all of the systemic vasculature, excluding the pulmonary vasculature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in LVSW After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke work refers to the work done by the ventricle to eject a volume of blood (i.e., stroke volume) into the aorta. Ventricular stroke work can be estimated as the product of stroke volume and mean aortic pressure during ejection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Oxygen Consumption (VO_2) After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Arteriovenous Oxygen Difference After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Arteriovenous oxygen difference is the difference in the oxygen content of the blood between the arterial blood and the venous blood. It is an indication of how much oxygen is removed from the blood in capillaries as the blood circulates in the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cardiac Output After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Cardiac output is equal to the stroke volume (the amount of blood pumped from a ventricle in a single heartbeat) times the heart rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Stroke Volume After Study Drug (Exercise)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke volume is the amount of blood pumped out of the heart (left ventricle - to the body) during each contraction.

clinical_study.condition: Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction

arm_group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.
Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

intervention.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

Normal saline placebo will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure. Hemodynamics will then be measured at baseline after study drug infusion and again during low level exercise (20 Watts).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled to undergo a cardiac catheterization procedure.
- Clinical symptoms of shortness of breath and fatigue
- Normal left ventricular ejection fraction (≥50%)
- Elevated left ventricular filling pressures at cardiac catheterization (defined as resting pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP)>15 mmHg and/or PCWP≥25 mmHg during exercise)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systolic BP <120 mmHg
- Prior nitrate therapy (within previous 2 weeks)
- Glucose 6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency
- Other "non-HFpEF" specific causes of heart failure such as significant valvular disease (>moderate left-sided regurgitation, >mild stenosis), severe pulmonary disease, unstable coronary disease or coronary spasm, primary renal or hepatic disease, constrictive pericarditis, or infiltrative, restrictive, or hypertrophic cardiomyopathies

results_reference.citation: Borlaug BA, Koepp KE, Melenovsky V. Sodium Nitrite Improves Exercise Hemodynamics and Ventricular Performance in Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2015 Oct 13;66(15):1672-82. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2015.07.067.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled in the trial between January and September 2014.

Ventricular stroke work can be estimated as the product of stroke volume and mean aortic pressure during ejection.

outcome.title: Change in Oxygen Consumption (VO_2) After Study Drug (Exercise)
outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)
outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration

group.title: Nitrite
group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

measure.title: Change in Oxygen Consumption (VO_2) After Study Drug (Exercise)
measure.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.)

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between the arms for change in oxygen consumption (VO_2) after study drug (exercise).

outcome.title: Change in Arteriovenous Oxygen Difference After Study Drug (Exercise)
outcome.description: Arteriovenous oxygen difference is the difference in the oxygen content of the blood between the arterial blood and the venous blood. It is an indication of how much oxygen is removed from the blood in capillaries as the blood circulates in the body.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration

group.title: Nitrite
group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

measure.title: Change in Arteriovenous Oxygen Difference After Study Drug (Exercise)
measure.description: Arteriovenous oxygen difference is the difference in the oxygen content of the blood between the arterial blood and the venous blood. It is an indication of how much oxygen is removed from the blood in capillaries as the blood circulates in the body.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between the arms for change in arteriovenous oxygen difference after study drug (exercise).

outcome.title: Change in Cardiac Output After Study Drug (Exercise)
outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Cardiac output is equal to the stroke volume (the amount of blood pumped from a ventricle in a single heartbeat) times the heart rate.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration

group.title: Nitrite
group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

measure.title: Change in Cardiac Output After Study Drug (Exercise)
measure.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Cardiac output is equal to the stroke volume (the amount of blood pumped from a ventricle in a single heartbeat) times the heart rate.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between the arms for change in cardiac output after study drug (exercise).

outcome.title: Change in Stroke Volume After Study Drug (Exercise)
outcome.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke volume is the amount of blood pumped out of the heart (left ventricle - to the body) during each contraction.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 30 minutes after study drug administration

group.title: Nitrite
group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

measure.title: Change in Stroke Volume After Study Drug (Exercise)
measure.description: Values are exercise values after receiving study drug minus exercise values before study drug (on the same day.) Stroke volume is the amount of blood pumped out of the heart (left ventricle - to the body) during each contraction.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison between the arms for change in stroke volume after study drug (exercise).

reported_events.time_frame: Subjects will be followed for adverse event reporting during the procedure and the recovery period, approximately 3 hours after the procedure on Day 1.

group.title: Nitrite
group.description: Study drug (NaNO_2 50 mcg/kg/min) will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Saline Placebo for Nitrite will be infused for 5 minutes during the cardiac catheterization procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
